item.title: Covid in Scotland: Most restrictions to end from 9 August
item.description: Social distancing will no longer be required in most locations - but the wearing of face coverings will continue.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jason Kenny claims British landmark as GB secure eight medals while Simone Biles wins bronze
item.description: Track cyclist Jason Kenny wins his eighth medal to become Great Britain's most decorated Olympian as GB secure eight podium finishes on Tuesday.

item.title: Womanâ€™s DNA helps convict her father for rape
item.description: An adoptee's discovery that her mother was raped at 13 leads to 11 years in jail for Carvel Bennett.

item.title: Tom Miller: Hiding student fell to death at illegal lockdown party
item.description: Rumours of a police raid prompted Tom Miller to climb out of a window, an inquest hears.

item.title: MV Asphalt Princess: Ship hijacked off UAE ordered to sail to Iran
item.description: The Panama-flagged tanker MV Asphalt Princess has been ordered to sail to Iran, officials say.

item.title: Covid-19: Scotland to end most Covid rules and cabinet splits over travel
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

item.title: Aya Hachem: Seven men guilty of drive-by shooting murder
item.description: Innocent passer-by Aya Hachem, 19, was shot dead in a feud between two Blackburn tyre firm owners.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: New York Governor sexually harassed women, report finds
item.description: The investigation comes months after several women accused Andrew Cuomo of sexual misconduct.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo ship that blocked Suez Canal arrives in Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Given docks at the Port of Felixstowe months after it was originally due to arrive.

item.title: Fenwick Colchester: Child, 5, dies of head injury sustained at department store
item.description: Police say specialist officers are supporting the boy's family following his death.

item.title: Covid: Boris Johnson will not meet Nicola Sturgeon during Scotland trip
item.description: The first minister had invited the PM to her official residence to discuss recovery after the pandemic.

item.title: Premier League players will continue to take the knee
item.description: Players from all 20 Premier League clubs will continue to take the knee as a symbol of their "unity against all forms of racism".

item.title: Drug dealers jailed after getting car stuck in trolley bay
item.description: Police found the men with crack cocaine and heroin after they crashed at a Morrison's supermarket.

item.title: 'Witnessing my mum be abused by her ex-partner'
item.description: Betty Harper, 19, wrote a song the night her mum, Natasha, was beaten by her then-partner.

item.title: Assisted dying: Campaigners renewed hope for change in the law
item.description: David Peace intends to travel abroad to end his life before his motor neurone disease deteriorates further.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: New Zealand's Laurel Hubbard set to 'hang up her boots'
item.description: The transgender weightlifter made Olympic history but says her time in the sport is probably up.

item.title: Grandfather lands 'biggest ever cod' in Scottish waters
item.description: The fish caught off Shetland weighed in at 49lbs (22kg) and left 60-year-old Tony Urwin "shattered".

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals â€“ and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Spennylympics: Couple taking on every Olympic sport in 17 days
item.description: They're attempting to complete all 96 individual events for charity within the timespan of Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Isles of Scilly walrus spotted off Republic of Ireland
item.description: Wally has been on the islands since June and has travelled thousands of miles around Europe.

item.title: Hugs and tears at Heathrow as families reunite
item.description: Changes to UK travel rules for fully vaccinated US and EU passengers have lead to emotional scenes.

item.title: Watch the moment Australian's handlebars fall off
item.description: Watch the moment when Australia's Alex Porter falls in the men's team pursuit following a handlebar failure.

item.title: 'The reason I'm doing this is because I was inspired by him'
item.description: Karim al-Jian was inspired to study medicine, after learning about a doctor who was killed helping civilians in Syria.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Bodies on the streets as fighting traps Lashkar Gah residents
item.description: Terrified locals are fleeing if they can as the Taliban and troops battle to control Lashkar Gah.

item.title: All you need to know about skateboarder Sky Brown
item.description: Brown is the all-singing, all-dancing medal hopeful with an unusual route to becoming a GB hopeful.

item.title: Levelling up: The seaside town fighting violence and frustration
item.description: Can the government's "levelling up" agenda help one of the most violent towns in England and Wales?

item.title: Ever Given: 'I just want to see how big it was and it's huge'
item.description: Onlookers have come from far and wide to see the Ever Given container ship come in to dock.

item.title: Covid-19: Behind-the-scenes battles over amber watchlist
item.description: Cabinet divisions over international travel rules spilled out into the open this week, writes Adam Fleming.

item.title: Bank fraud: â€˜I had Â£9,000 stolen from my accountâ€™
item.description: Scam victims are having difficulties getting bank support after losing cash, consumer group Which? says.

item.title: Analysis: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: The collapse of Enron and the dark side of business
item.description: Twenty years on from the collapse of Enron, are the rules preventing corporate fraud tough enough?

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: I stopped drinking - then baking business turned my life around
item.description: Lesley Smith gave up alcohol for the sake of her children but had "no outlet" until she found a passion for making cakes.

item.title: F1's Esteban Ocon: How it feels winning your first Formula 1 race
item.description: The 24-year-old Frenchman pulled off a huge F1 shock by winning the Hungarian Grand Prix

item.title: Malmo stun Rangers in Champions League
item.description: A "big moment" from Steven Davis has given Rangers "an important lifeline" in their quest for the Champions League group stage despite defeat by Swedish side Malmo, says boss Steven Gerrard.

item.title: 'I could tell straight away' - Referee Taylor reflects on moment Eriksen collapsed
item.description: Referee Anthony Taylor tells BBC Sport about the moment Denmark star Christian Eriksen collapsed after a cardiac arrest during Euro 2020.

item.title: 'They live for their sport and their little boy Albie' - GB's medal-winning power couple
item.description: Laura and Jason Kenny both win silver within 20 minutes of each other as they continue to cement their place in British Olympic history.

item.title: Willey hits highest score of men's Hundred to fire Superchargers to victory over Spirit
item.description: David Willey's extraordinary hitting fires Northern Superchargers to a crushing 63-run win over London Spirit in the men's Hundred.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Keely Hodgkinson wins silver in 800m final
item.description: Nineteen-year-old Keely Hodgkinson wins 800m silver for Team GB at the Tokyo Olympics, breaking Dame Kelly Holmes' British record with a time of one minute 55.88 seconds.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jamaica's Elaine Thompson-Herah takes gold in 200m final
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah confirms her place among the pantheon of sprint greats as she completes an Olympic 100m-200m double for the second time with a sensational victory in Tokyo.

item.title: The Hundred - London Spirit v Northern Superchargers: David Willey hits six sixes in unbeaten 81
item.description: Watch all six of David Willey's sixes in his unbeaten 81 - the highest individual score of the men's Hundred so far - as Northern Superchargers make 155-3 against London Spirit at Lord's.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB and Denmark collide in men's team pursuit
item.description: Drama in the men's team pursuit qualifying as Denmark's rider collides with GB's Charlie Tanfield.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Elaine Thompson-Herah completes unprecedented 'double-double'
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah confirms her place among the pantheon of sprint greats as she secures an unprecedented women's 100m-200m 'double-double' with a sensational victory over the longer distance in Tokyo.

item.title: Simone Biles: USA gymnast returns at Tokyo Olympics with strong performance in beam final
item.description: USA's Simone Biles returns to competition with a strong performance in the beam final and wins bronze at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Karsten Warholm sets stunning 400m hurdles world record
item.description: Norwegian Karsten Warholm runs a stunning men's 400m hurdles race to obliterate his previous world record and take gold at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Keely Hodgkinson wins silver behind USA's Athing Mu
item.description: Teenager Keely Hodgkinson wins 800m silver at the Olympic Games in a new British record of 1:55.88 as US star Athing Mu takes gold.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Pat McCormack wins boxing silver at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Pat McCormack wins a silver medal for Great Britain after losing a hard-fought men's welterweight contest to Cuba's Roniel Iglesias in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Giles Scott wins Finn class, gold in men's 49er & silver in mixed Nacra 17
item.description: Great Britain win two golds and a silver on a thrilling day in sailing at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Gemili's 200m medal hopes dashed by injury
item.description: British sprinter Adam Gemili's hopes of a medal in the men's 200m are dashed as he pulls up with an injury in the heats.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB track cyclist Ed Clancy announces retirement and pulls out of remaining events
item.description: Great Britain's Ed Clancy withdraws from the remainder of Tokyo 2020 and announces his retirement from track cycling because of a persistent back injury.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Simone Biles on start list for beam final
item.description: Simone Biles will compete in the beam final as she takes up her final chance of an individual medal at an Olympics where she has withdrawn from four other finals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Jodie Williams and Ama Pipi through to semi-finals of women's 400m
item.description: Britain's Jodie Williams wins her heat to join Shaunae Miller-Uibo and Allyson Felix in the 400m semi-finals, with fellow Briton Ama Pipi also qualifying as a fastest loser.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: People vaccinated in Europe or the US will no longer need to isolate when arriving from amber countries.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: A record number of alerts are being sent by the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: â€˜Covid passportsâ€™: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.
